Experienced Representation To Help You Recover For Your Construction Site Accident Injury

Construction sites are filled with hazards. Too often, contractors and subcontractors ignore safety requirements in the interest of getting the job out quickly with as little expense as possible.

Representing Injured People Throughout Columbus For 50 Years

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, we represent those injured in construction accidents, auto accidents, and other types of personal injury incidents.

Our firm has a 50-year tradition of representing injured people and the families of wrongful death victims in Columbus and throughout Ohio.

Common Types Of Construction Accidents

We know the law and have built a reputation for handling cases involving:

  • Construction site falls: When a hole is left open on the floor, when debris is left on the site or when fall protection harnesses fail, framers, roofers and other workers can fall and suffer head injury, spinal cord injury, broken bones or wrongful death.
  • Truck and forklift accidents: Construction site safety violations can result in the unsafe use of trucks, forklifts and earth movers. Trucks falling into excavations or backing over workers can cause catastrophic injuries.
  • Cranes, heavy machinery: When cranes and heavy machinery are used without regard to safety regulations or appropriate training, the operators and those around them can all be in danger of injury.
  • Electrical burns, electrocution: Makeshift electrical connections can cause shocks, burns and electrocution.

Contact Our Lawyers Today. Free Consults.

If you are injured in a construction site accident, contact us today to schedule an appointment with one of our experienced attorneys.

We offer a free consultation, and there are no legal fees unless we recover compensation for you. You can contact us online or reach us at 614-360-2706.
